schemes.brief_description: Direct income support of ₹6,000/year to small & marginal farmers in three equal installments.
schemes.detailed_description: PM-KISAN provides financial support to landholding farmer families. The amount is transferred directly to the beneficiary's bank account in three equal installments of ₹2,000 each every four months. The scheme aims to supplement the financial needs of farmers for procuring inputs and meeting domestic expenses.

other_conditions: Must be a landholding farmer family
Family should have cultivable land in their name
Excludes institutional landholders, higher income taxpayers

schemes.benefits: ₹6,000 per year in 3 equal installments of ₹2,000 each, directly to bank account.
application_process: Visit PM-KISAN portal or nearest CSC
Fill application form with land details

schemes.brief_description: Crop insurance scheme for farmers against natural calamities, pests and diseases.
schemes.detailed_description: PMFBY provides comprehensive crop insurance from pre-sowing to post-harvest. Farmers pay a nominal premium; the rest is subsidized by the government. Claims are settled on the basis of crop cutting experiments or weather-based triggers. It covers yield loss and prevented sowing.

other_conditions: Must have insurable interest in the crop
Loanee farmers are covered compulsorily
Non-loanee farmers can opt in voluntarily

schemes.benefits: Insurance payout for crop loss due to natural calamities, pests, diseases. Premium as low as 1.5% for kharif, 1% for rabi, 5% for commercial/horticultural crops.
application_process: Register through bank (if loanee) or Common Service Centre / insurance company
In case of loss, intimate and submit claim form
Settlement based on crop cutting experiments or weather data
schemes.application_deadline: Varies by crop season; check state/insurance company

schemes.brief_description: Credit card for farmers for short-term crop loans, term loans for agriculture and allied activities.
schemes.detailed_description: KCC provides adequate and timely credit to farmers for cultivation, purchase of inputs, and other short-term needs. Interest subvention is available for prompt repayment. Limit is based on landholding and cropping pattern. Now extended to animal husbandry and fisheries.

other_conditions: Individual farmers, joint borrowers, tenant farmers
Fisheries and animal husbandry farmers eligible under KCC

schemes.benefits: Credit limit for crop and allied activities; interest subvention (concessional rate) for prompt repayment; one-time documentation, revolving credit.
application_process: Submit application with land and identity proof
Bank assesses limit and issues KCC
Draw cash/limit as per need within sanctioned limit

schemes.brief_description: Free soil health cards to farmers with nutrient status and recommended doses of fertilizers.
schemes.detailed_description: Every farmer gets a Soil Health Card every 2 years. The card shows nutrient status of the soil (N, P, K, micronutrients, pH) and recommends type and quantity of fertilizers. Aims to promote balanced use of fertilizers and improve soil health.

other_conditions: Must be a farmer with cultivable land

schemes.benefits: Free Soil Health Card every 2 years with nutrient status and fertilizer recommendations; helps reduce input cost and improve yield.
application_process: Register at agriculture department or online portal

schemes.brief_description: Online national market for agricultural produce to enable transparent price discovery and direct selling.
schemes.detailed_description: e-NAM integrates existing APMC mandis into a single online platform. Farmers can sell produce to buyers across states. Electronic auction, payment and assaying facilities. Aims to remove intermediaries and ensure better prices for farmers.

other_conditions: Farmers registered in linked APMC mandis can trade on e-NAM

schemes.benefits: Access to pan-India buyers, transparent auction, electronic payment, assaying at mandi, better price discovery.
application_process: Register at nearest e-NAM linked mandi
Bring produce to mandi or use assaying
Participate in e-auction; payment to bank account

schemes.scheme_name: Post Matric Scholarship for SC Students
schemes.brief_description: Scholarship for Scheduled Caste students studying at post-matriculation level to reduce financial burden.
schemes.detailed_description: Central sector scheme for SC students pursuing post-matric/post-secondary education. Covers tuition fee, maintenance allowance, and other allowances. Income ceiling applies. Implemented through states and National Scholarship Portal.

eligibility_criteria.income_limit: Family income up to ₹2.5 lakh per annum
other_conditions: Must belong to Scheduled Caste
Admitted to recognized post-matric/post-secondary course
Should not be receiving similar scholarship from other sources

schemes.benefits: Tuition fee reimbursement, maintenance allowance (₹230–₹1200/month as per course), and other allowances. Varies by course and level.
schemes.application_deadline: Usually October–November; check NSP for current year

schemes.scheme_name: Post Matric Scholarship for OBC Students
schemes.brief_description: Scholarship for Other Backward Class students at post-matriculation level.
schemes.detailed_description: Central scheme for OBC students in post-matric/post-secondary education. Covers tuition fee and maintenance allowance. Income ceiling applies. Disbursed through states via National Scholarship Portal.

eligibility_criteria.income_limit: Family income up to ₹1 lakh per annum (creamy layer excluded)
other_conditions: Must belong to OBC (non-creamy layer)
Admitted to recognized post-matric course
Not availing similar scholarship

schemes.benefits: Tuition fee and maintenance allowance as per norms; amount varies by course and level.

schemes.brief_description: Single window for multiple central and state scholarships for school and higher education.
schemes.detailed_description: NSP hosts various scholarships: pre-matric and post-matric for SC/ST/OBC/minorities, merit-cum-means, and others. One registration, one application per scheme. Scholarships disbursed directly to bank accounts.

other_conditions: Eligibility differs for each scholarship; check scheme on NSP

schemes.benefits: Varies by scholarship: fee reimbursement, maintenance, one-time grants. Direct Benefit Transfer to bank.

schemes.brief_description: Scholarship for wards of ex-servicemen/reaching personnel for professional degree courses.
schemes.detailed_description: PMSS provides scholarships to dependents of ex-servicemen and personnel of armed forces and paramilitary for technical/professional degree courses. Run by Kendriya Sainik Board. Merit-based with income criteria.

eligibility_criteria.income_limit: Family income up to ₹8 lakh per annum
other_conditions: Ward of ex-servicemen/war widows/disabled in action/serving personnel (min 5 years)
Admitted to first year of recognized professional degree
Minimum 60% in qualifying exam

schemes.benefits: ₹2,500/month for boys and ₹3,000/month for girls for degree courses; higher for PG. Renewal based on academic progress.
application_process: Register on KSB/Rajya Sainik Board portal

schemes.scheme_name: Begum Hazrat Mahal National Scholarship (Minority Girls)
schemes.brief_description: Merit-cum-means scholarship for girl students from minority communities in classes 9 to 12.
schemes.detailed_description: Scheme for girl students from minority communities (Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Parsi, Jain) studying in classes 9–12. Covers tuition and maintenance. Implemented through Maulana Azad Education Foundation and state agencies.

eligibility_criteria.income_limit: Family income up to ₹2 lakh per annum
other_conditions: Must belong to notified minority community
Girl student in class 9, 10, 11 or 12
Minimum 50% in previous class

schemes.benefits: Tuition fee (up to ₹10,000/year) and maintenance (₹500/month for day scholars, ₹1,000 for hostellers).
application_process: Apply through NSP or state/MAEF portal

schemes.scheme_name: Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB-PMJAY)
schemes.brief_description: Health insurance cover of ₹5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary hospitalization.
schemes.detailed_description: PMJAY provides cashless health cover to economically vulnerable families. Coverage is based on SECC 2011 and other criteria. Empanelled hospitals provide cashless treatment. No cap on family size or age. Covers pre-existing conditions.

eligibility_criteria.income_limit: Deprivation criteria as per SECC (rural) and defined occupational criteria (urban)
other_conditions: Family in SECC database with defined deprivation
Or families meeting state-defined eligibility
No income certificate needed if in SECC list

schemes.benefits: ₹5 lakh per family per year for hospitalization; cashless at empanelled hospitals; covers 1,900+ procedures.
required_documents: Ration card or other identity; eligibility as per SECC/state list
application_process: Check eligibility on pmjay.gov.in or via helpline

schemes.brief_description: Maternity benefit of ₹5,000 in three installments to pregnant women and lactating mothers for first live birth.
schemes.detailed_description: PMMVY provides partial wage compensation to women for wage loss during pregnancy and after delivery. Benefit is for first living child. Amount is paid in three installments upon meeting conditions (registration, antenatal check-up, child birth registration and immunization).

eligibility_criteria.state: All India (excluding those receiving similar benefit from state)
other_conditions: Pregnant woman or lactating mother
First living child only
Not availing similar maternity benefit from government

schemes.benefits: ₹5,000 in three installments (₹1,000 + ₹2,000 + ₹2,000) on meeting conditionalities; DBT to bank/post office account.
application_process: Register at Anganwadi or health facility
Fill PMMVY form with bank details
First installment after registration; second after ANC; third after birth registration and first immunization
schemes.application_deadline: Within 730 days of first child birth

schemes.brief_description: Cash assistance to pregnant women for institutional delivery to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality.
schemes.detailed_description: JSY promotes institutional delivery by providing cash assistance to pregnant women. Amount varies by state (higher in low-performing states). Payment is made to mother after delivery at government or accredited private facility.

eligibility_criteria.income_limit: BPL or defined categories in states
eligibility_criteria.state: All India (amount and criteria vary by state)
other_conditions: Pregnant woman
Delivery in government or accredited private facility
BPL or as per state eligibility

schemes.benefits: Cash assistance (₹700–₹1,400 in rural, ₹600–₹1,000 in urban; higher in low-performing states) after institutional delivery.
application_process: Register at health facility or Anganwadi
Undertake ANC and deliver at institution
schemes.application_deadline: Rolling; claim within stipulated period post delivery

schemes.scheme_name: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS)
schemes.brief_description: Monthly pension to BPL elderly (60+) under National Social Assistance Programme.
schemes.detailed_description: IGNOAPS provides monthly pension to destitute elderly belonging to BPL families. Central assistance is ₹200/month (80+ gets ₹500); states add their share. Part of NSAP implemented by states/UTs.

other_conditions: Must be in BPL list
Destitute with little or no regular support

schemes.benefits: ₹200/month (60–79 years); ₹500/month (80+). States may add; total varies by state.
application_process: Apply at block/municipal office or through state portal

schemes.brief_description: Guaranteed pension of ₹1,000–₹5,000 per month after 60 years; government co-contribution for eligible subscribers.
schemes.detailed_description: APY is a pension scheme for workers in unorganized sector. Subscriber contributes till 60 and receives guaranteed pension. Pension amount depends on contribution. Government co-contributes 50% of subscriber contribution (max ₹1,000/year) for 5 years for those who joined before 2015–16 and are not income tax payers.

eligibility_criteria.income_limit: Any; co-contribution only for non-tax payers who joined in 2015–16
other_conditions: Must have savings bank account
Indian citizen
Join between 18–40 to get pension from 60

schemes.benefits: Guaranteed pension ₹1,000–₹5,000/month (based on contribution) from 60 years; spouse gets pension after subscriber's death; nominee gets corpus if both die.
application_process: Open/use savings account in participating bank or post office
Fill APY form and choose pension amount

schemes.brief_description: Pension scheme for senior citizens (60+) offering guaranteed return and pension for 10 years.
schemes.detailed_description: PMVVY is a senior citizen pension scheme sold through LIC. One-time investment; pension paid monthly for 10 years. Guaranteed return (as notified). On maturity, purchase price returned. Available for subscription as per government notification.

other_conditions: Minimum age 60 years
Subscription as per LIC/notification (scheme may be closed for new subscription)

schemes.benefits: Guaranteed monthly pension for 10 years; return of purchase price on maturity. Rate and cap as per notification.
application_process: Choose pension amount and pay lump sum
Pension credited monthly; maturity after 10 years
schemes.application_deadline: Check LIC; scheme subscription period notified by government

schemes.brief_description: Small savings scheme for girl child; deposit up to ₹1.5 lakh/year; maturity at 21 or marriage after 18.
schemes.detailed_description: SSY account can be opened for girl child below 10 years. Deposit up to ₹1.5 lakh per financial year. Interest and maturity amount are tax-free. Account matures at 21 or on marriage after 18. Partial withdrawal for education after 18 allowed.

other_conditions: Only one account per girl in post office or bank
Guardian opens on behalf of girl

schemes.benefits: Tax-free interest (rate as notified); maturity amount; partial withdrawal for education after 18; max deposit ₹1.5 lakh/year.
application_process: Visit post office or participating bank
Fill SSY form and submit documents
Deposit annually; account matures at 21 or marriage after 18

schemes.brief_description: National campaign to improve child sex ratio and promote education and welfare of the girl child.
schemes.detailed_description: BBBP focuses on preventing gender-biased sex selection, ensuring survival and protection of girl child, and promoting her education and participation. Implemented through districts; includes awareness, enforcement of PC&PNDT Act, and conditional cash transfers in some states.

eligibility_criteria.age_range: any (beneficiaries are girls and their families)
other_conditions: Scheme is awareness and enabling; specific benefits (e.g. state CCTs) have their own eligibility

schemes.benefits: Awareness and behaviour change; state-level incentives for girl child (e.g. Sukanya, Ladli); improved access to education and protection.
application_process: No single application; access through Anganwadi, schools, health facilities
For state-specific incentives, apply as per state guidelines

schemes.brief_description: Loans up to ₹10 lakh to non-corporate small businesses (Shishu/Kishore/Tarun) without collateral.
schemes.detailed_description: MUDRA provides loans through banks, NBFCs and MFIs to micro and small enterprises. Three categories: Shishu (up to ₹50,000), Kishore (₹50,001–₹5 lakh), Tarun (₹5–10 lakh). No collateral for small amounts. Supports income-generating activities.

other_conditions: Non-corporate small business: manufacturing, trading, services
New or existing unit
Loan for business purpose

schemes.benefits: Loan up to ₹10 lakh (Shishu/Kishore/Tarun); no collateral for small loans; interest as per bank/MFI.
application_process: Approach bank, NBFC or MFI offering MUDRA loans

schemes.brief_description: Margin money subsidy for setting up micro-enterprises; project cost up to ₹25 lakh (manufacturing) / ₹10 lakh (services).
schemes.detailed_description: PMEGP provides financial assistance for setting up new micro-enterprises. Margin money subsidy (15–35% of project cost) through KVIC, state KVIBs and DICs. Rest is bank loan. Special category (SC/ST/OBC/minorities/women etc.) get higher subsidy.

other_conditions: Only new projects
No existing unit from same proprietor in same state
Project cost: manufacturing up to ₹25 lakh, services up to ₹10 lakh

schemes.benefits: Margin money subsidy 15–35% of project cost; balance as bank loan. Subsidy higher for special categories and backward areas.
application_process: Apply online at kviconline.gov.in or through KVIC/KVIB/DIC
Recommendation to bank; subsidy released after unit setup and margin money contribution
schemes.application_deadline: Check KVIC portal for annual deadline
